meanings.definition: Make a bubbling sound while flowing.
meanings.sent1: The stream will gurgle as it flows over the rocks.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the water gurgle as it rushed down the drain.
meanings.sent3: The tea kettle began to gurgle happily on the stove.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to gurgle like a brook in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The baby's gurgling laughter filled the room with joy.

meanings.definition: Flow or run with a bubbling sound.
meanings.sent1: The fountain will gurgle softly in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The river gurgled gently as it meandered through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The old pipes in the house always seem to gurgle at night.
meanings.sent4: His stomach began to gurgle loudly after eating too quickly.
meanings.sent5: The coffee machine started to gurgle, signaling the fresh brew was ready.

meanings.sent1: The gurgle of the brook was soothing to listen to.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the gurgle of the fish tank in the quiet room.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected gurgle of the drain made her jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The gurgle of the espresso machine signaled the start of a busy morning.
meanings.sent5: The gurgle of the baby's stomach made everyone chuckle at the dinner table.
